poem.title: At the Ironmongers
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: "A gross of six-inch nails and a gallon can of one-coat gloss, White." The boy in the blue coat gawps. "Please." (A language problem?) "A gross of extra-sensitive galoshes." He still gawks, Then slumps to the counter. Sticking out of his back: A Cheyenne arrow, suckered like a lamprey.
